alert.note: Alert for Le Flore; Pushmataha (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 31 at 11:21AM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM CST THIS EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Arkansas and Oklahoma, including the following counties, in Arkansas, Carroll, Crawford, Franklin, Madison and Sebastian. In Oklahoma, Haskell, Latimer, Le Flore, Pushmataha and Sequoyah. * WHEN...From 6 PM CST this evening through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rain and thunderstorms will increase across parts of southeast Oklahoma into western Arkansas tonight and early Saturday. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches area likely in the watch area, with isolated amounts near 4 inches possible. A few rivers and creeks may rise to near flood stage, with local flash flooding possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
